item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 2:45 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Orbit. Mozilla's AI Assistant for Firefox (74 points | 53 comments)
2. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps, and I can't stop (85 points | 25 comments)
3. "A Course of Pure Mathematics" – G. H. Hardy (1921) [pdf] (124 points | 25 comments)
4. Dumping Memory to Bypass BitLocker on Windows 11 (193 points | 125 comments)
5. I Wrote a Game Boy Advance Game in Zig (74 points | 22 comments)
6. Beyond Gradient Averaging in Parallel Optimization (49 points | 10 comments)
7. Monokai Pro for Jetbrains (11 points | 7 comments)
8. Cook: Colliding with the SHA prefix of Linux's initial Git commit (28 points | 9 comments)
9. Lightstorm: Minimalistic Ruby Compiler (32 points | 4 comments)
10. Jack Elam and the Fly in 'Once Upon a Time in the West' (56 points | 9 comments)
11. Learning Solver Design: Automating Factorio Balancers (146 points | 20 comments)
12. LineageOS 22 Released (65 points | 14 comments)
13. I made a tiny library for switches and sum types in Lua (21 points | 2 comments)
14. Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died (806 points | 68 comments)
15. Curl-Impersonate (371 points | 92 comments)
16. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (19 points | 4 comments)
17. 'Obelisks': New class of life has been found in human digestive system (340 points | 111 comments)
18. Execution units are often pipelined (145 points | 74 comments)
19. Short Message Compression Using LLMs (165 points | 79 comments)
20. How Well Do LLMs Generate Code for Different Application Domains? (51 points | 12 comments)
21. RubyConf 2024: Cloud Native Buildpack Hackday (and other Ruby deploy tools, too) (46 points | 6 comments)
22. China to Build Thorium Molten-Salt Reactor in 2025 (84 points | 37 comments)
23. The Homa Network Protocol (61 points | 12 comments)
24. Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought? (4 points | discuss)
25. Ts_zip: Text Compression Using Large Language Models (111 points | 40 comments)
26. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (167 points | 54 comments)
27. Performance of LLMs on Advent of Code 2024 (46 points | 26 comments)
28. Beyond BLE: Cracking Open the Black-Box of RF Microcontrollers [video] (97 points | 14 comments)
29. Behind the Scenes: Alien Worlds – Jumpship over a tidally locked planet (18 points | 1 comment)
30. Database mocks are not worth it (129 points | 177 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 2:45 AM UTC
